DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether transcutaneous sacral nerve stimulation ( TENS SNS ) versus percutaneous tibial nerve stimulation ( PTNS ) effective therapeutic option subject idiopathic overactive bladder ( OAB ) fail conventional therapy . Our primary hypothesis TENS therapy effective treatment option due ease use improve subject compliance form therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Electrical Nerve Stimulation Overactive Bladder Comparison Treatments
DOC.detailed_description: To compare long-term efficacy , subject compliance , subject satisfaction percutaneous tibial nerve stimulation ( PTNS ) therapy versus transcutaneous electrical sacral nerve stimulation ( TENS ) treatment subject idiopathic overactive bladder . Previous short-term study suggest therapy equal efficacy improve OAB symptom , hypothesize long-term efficacy success actually high TENS group due ease use , since subject self-administer therapy . Secondary goal evaluate subject quality life improvement score , bladder diary score ( change frequency urination ) , change urodynamic study undergo therapy .
DOC.criteria: Female Age > 18 year Predominant complaint urge urinary incontinence ( 3 episode per week ) OR overactive bladder ( 8 void per day , and/or 2 void per night ) Failed trial conservative therapy ( bladder training , fluid modification , diet modification , caffeine restriction , pelvic floor training ) Failed trial anticholinergic either due inability take medication , adverse reaction medication , improvement medication Willing mentally competent participate study Willing complete study questionnaires No contraindication undergo PTNS TENS therapy Age < 18 year Presence urinary fistula Male . ( Males exclude different etiology overactive bladder male primarily cause prostate problem men versus primarily idiopathic cause woman ) . Recurrent current urinary tract infection ( 5 infection last 12 month ) Bladder stone Bladder cancer suspect bladder cancer Hematuria Pregnancy plan become pregnant study ( urine pregnancy test administer premenopausal hysterectomy ) Central peripheral neurologic disorder Multiple Sclerosis , Parkinson 's disease , spina bifida , spinal cord lesion Metal implant pacemaker , implantable defibrillator , metal implant PTNS TENS device need place ( sacrum ankle/leg ) . Uncontrolled diabetes Diabetes peripheral nerve involvement On anticoagulant Current use anticholinergic use within last 4 week Current use botox bladder injection bladder botox injection within last year Current use interstim therapy currently implant interstim device lead Bladder outlet obstruction Urinary retention gastric retention Painful Bladder Syndrome/Interstitial Cystitis
